content.description: Stand start with hands on the sloped rail to the left of "Biggie Smalls". Go straight up, and pull the lip. From here, it's easy slab climbing to the top. The crux comes at the lip.
content.location: It is to the left of Biggie Smalls.

content.description:
Speculation is the traverse in to the awesome route Conjecture. 

 Start on one of the jugs by the crack. Traverse the low rail to get into the start of Conjecture. Finish up with the crux moves to the lip and mantel. Fight the pump and don’t forget the beta.
content.location: Choose a jug at the crack to start on, and move left.

content.description: This is an easy high-ball slab problem that provides for a good warm-up in this area.
content.location: It is to the left of "Green". See the photo.

content.description: Leaf Gully is a short, little route that basically just pulls the lip and finishes through the gully which is usually filled with leaves.
content.location: It is located to the right of the big crack. The starting crimps are around head height.

content.description: Sit start low on the bottom flake in the obvious crack. Move up through and over the lip. Scramble the gully to the top.
content.protection: A couple of pads especially to pad the tree directly behind you.
content.location: Start low in the only crack.

content.description: Start on jug, and move up the face. It is good to get the feel of the sharpness of the rock here.
content.location: To the left of the overhang there’s a mossy crack and face.

content.description: Start low almost from a sit. You’ll find a deep jug in the crack and a blocky jug just above it to start. Work the sloper rail up to some deadly quartz gastons. Gain the quartz flake to set for the throw to the lip. There are good jugs out left to get over the lip. Scramble to the top. Overhung. Hard. Bring your tape. Ryan’s sick beta foregoes the quartz gastons.
content.protection: I’d say at least two pads, the more the merrier. The landing isn’t terrible but slightly sloped. I recommend a spotter for the topout.
content.location: This is the center most route on the overhang.

content.description: Sit start below the biggest flake on the left end of the rock face. Work your way straight up the face, using the big flake and the smaller flake above it. Pull a mantel move, and climb the 10 feet of slab to the top.
content.protection: Definitely as pad and maybe a spotter.
content.location: It is on the left end of the rock face below the big flake. See the beta photo for Dan at the starting position.

content.description: Start at the chest high flake by the crack. Move up as you would for Guesswork, but before you pull the lip, traverse left along the face on quartz holds. Top as you would for Conjecture/Speculation.
content.protection: Three or four pads are ideal.

content.description: This is the first really nice boulder you’ll find. There’s a dead tree on the left side as well as an overhanging crack.
